alert.note: Alert for Madison; Walker (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 16 at 8:29AM CDT until May 17 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Bedias Creek near Madisonville affecting Madison and Walker Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Bedias Creek near Madisonville. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins as water escapes the main channel in the vicinity of the gage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 19.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 AM CDT Tuesday was 20.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 9.4 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.8 feet on 05/30/1979. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Bedias Creek Madisonvill 19.0 19.8 Tue 7 am CDT 18.6 17.6 15.3 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 230 AM CDT.
